oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dissemination of foot-and-mouth disease virus through animal products: Foreign Animal Diseases
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Callis, J. J.
Mckercher, P. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: animal products
Artificial insemination
cattle diseases
Disease transmission
Epidemiology
Foot and mouth disease
Meat hygiene
Milk
Reviews
Semen
Survival
Foreign Animal Diseases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In summary, any and all products from animals infected with FMD may be possible sources of the virus and a means whereby the disease can be transported from one country to another. Some animal products may be imported; however, the procedures which are followed must be exacting, based on sound knowledge about the product and closely controlled. One means of handling these materials is to permit their entry only under special conditions which provide for transport, quarantine, and processing, all of which must be under official supervision and which must be done in such a way to assure that the processing inactivates the virus and that the virus does not escape by way of a byproduct of the manufacturing process.
